FILE: cm070200v11.0.txt
DYAD: MEXICO - UNITED KINGDOM
RIVALRY: RIV192
DISPUTE(S): MID135 
RIVALRY: RIV193
DISPUTE(S): MID2311 MID2310 

PSNOTES: 
PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20170803
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20170803

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

Pre-1900 MIDs: MID135

WWI MIDs: MID2310

MID2311 

TERRMID: MID2311 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID2311 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2311 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2311 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2311 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2311 1 -- certain
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2311 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2311 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2311 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2311 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID2311 from NYT 2/14/1914, UK sent troops into Mexico in response to US advice that the British embassy might be the target of an attack during the ongoing revolution in Mexico. Coded civil war MID because there was an ongoing civil conflict and revolution in Mexico, and this caused Britain to deploy troops to its embassy to protect against an attack there. 

CIVWARLINK: MID2311 3 -- not civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2311 1 -- certain
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID2311 no civil war in states connected to, but outside, this dyad.

COUPMID: MID2311 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2311 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2311 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2311 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

RIVNOTES: 

NARRATIVE-CM:

SOURCES-CM:

NARRATIVE-CR:

SOURCES-CR:

NYT 2/14/1914
